data.title: Peek UI Debugger error click-through path wrong
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0-insider cdaa5f28efd6d6fa012a34a92a6cf3fe57928b38
- OS Version: Ubuntu Linux 16.04.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open folder with some javascript/typescript and use default launch.json
2. hit ctrl F5
3. when the debugger reports an error in peek ui, the path link description is correct, but when clicking on it, it tries to navigate to the path relative to the root of the project.

The same version in windows behaves correctly. Older versions of VSCode (before the peek ui started being used for debug errors) also behaves correctly (up until February 2017 release)

![selection_039](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/851696/26249534/468bd2f2-3ca7-11e7-843d-97d6d1624503.png)

data.title: Terminal doesn't start at all
data.body:

- VSCode Version: master
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. script\npm install which compile some terminal C code
2. start script\code
3. try to open the terminal.

You get:

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/26248785/0b4021e2-3ca4-11e7-9dec-bf2e4fb25f26.png)

Some setup work before I pulled and ran scripts\npm install.

data.title: Feature-request: Please add command to "run last run task"

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Task runner is great, I type <run task> keybinding followed by substring of name of task to execute.
e.g. 'Ctrl+Shift+B' then 'int' for my 'Build Integration tests' task.

If I could bind another keybinding to run the last run task then I could use the above operation to effectively switch between build configurations and this proposed new feature to execute the build configuration.

Thanks

data.title: Network: VSCode does not open folders from network share

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
### System
- VSCode Version: `1.13.0-insider 613724d43b4d50f6052bbb8007447ca96e687f26`
- OS Version: Windows `10.0.14393.1066`

### Problem
#### Description
I select a folder from a network share to open and no folder is opened

#### Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a new window of Code (<kbd>ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>shift</kbd>+<kbd>n</kbd>)
2. click on `Open Folder`
3. select a folder from a network share

#### Result:
Nothing happens. Window stays the same with "Open Folder" button

#### Sample:
![2017-05-19_14-17-14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4992870/26247959/8873d338-3ca0-11e7-8268-88103c555104.gif)

data.title: Broken syntax highlight when inserting PHP inside <style> tag
markdown preview doesn't show images with whitespace in filename (on Linux)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:16:25.899Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.9.0-0.bpo.2-amd64
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.12.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|vscode-todo-parser|minhthai|1.8.9|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.4|;


---
I did a search for this issue and found this closed issue: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7898 which seems to be the same problem.

This is obviously for an other version of Code and on an other OS.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. This works fine: `![Test image](images/test_image.svg)` as long as `test_image.svg` exists
2. Replace the underscore with a whitespace and rename the file accordingly, now it just shows `![Test image](images/test image.svg)` in the preview i.e. just the text, no image.

data.title: Found Modules or Symbols no longer have IntelliSense priority [BUG]
data.body:
# Description
When importing a symbol from another module, IntelliSense detects importable modules.
Before 1.12.1 found modules or symbols (of modules) were prioritized in the suggestion display, as of 1.12.1, they no longer are.
Code snippets now seem to have the same priority, and all suggestions are sorted alphabetically.

If **nothing was typed yet**, symbol suggestions are prioritized as expected, modules are still ordered alphabetically.

# Spec information
- VSCode Version:
1.12.1 & 1.12.2
- OS Version:
Ubuntu 16.04 x64

# Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create any typescript module with any exported symbol
2. Import the symbol from another typescript file

# Screenshot Documentation:
For modules:
![selection_078](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16593597/26240311/d92ec5aa-3c80-11e7-90c5-dc283decd89f.png)
For symbols:
![selection_076](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16593597/26240313/d931fe28-3c80-11e7-9ffb-45992bea2bb5.png)
Does not appear if nothing was typed yet:
![selection_077](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16593597/26240312/d930ca08-3c80-11e7-93df-30666f655456.png)
Module import not affected:
![selection_079](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16593597/26240922/19cdf110-3c83-11e7-8e60-b56f0980d9c8.png)

data.title: Allow to customize explorer file sort order
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Debian Stretch

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create new files: user.js, user_session.js, user_data.js
2. files are displayed in this order:
  user_data.js
  user_session.js
  user.js

Expected behaviour: Normal alphabetical sort order:
  user.js
  user_data.js
  user_session.js

- OS Version: OSX 10.11

data.title: Formatting: add option to insert space before constructor parenthesis
data.body:
I can't seem to figure out if it's currently possible to have the formatter insert spaces before constructor parenthesis like there's an option to do so with functions.
`"javascript.format.insertSpaceBeforeFunctionParenthesis"`
The same but for the constructors will be really nice.

data.title: Feature: navigate ES6 'imports' - open file under cursor
data.body: An intelligent version of vim's `gf` command to 'open file under cursor', appending a `.js` if necessary, and opening the relevant `index.js` if the 'file' in question is a dir path.

data.title: Invalid Arguments warning is shown.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (cdaa5f28efd6d6fa012a34a92a6cf3fe57928b38, 2017-05-19T05:06:01.981Z)

|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.7.0|
|react-redux-es6-snippets|timothymclane|2.0.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open JS file
2. Create an array, i.e `const array = [1,2,3]`
2. And when you type for example `array.` and then intellisense shows the options after dot and if you press enter by selecting any option the below warning is shown saying `Invalid Arguments`

![screen shot 2017-05-19 at 11 54 00 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6011865/26235634/fad23a3a-3c89-11e7-90fb-50e0bef09937.png)

PS: All extensions are in disabled mode.

data.title: Characters entering in the IME are not displayed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|vs-code-xml-format|fabianlauer|0.1.5|
|gc-excelviewer|GrapeCity|1.1.15|
|vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter|lonefy|0.2.3|
|HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3|
|mssql|ms-mssql|1.0.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.9.0|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.14|
|aspnet-helper|schneiderpat|0.6.3|
|ayu|teabyii|0.2.1|
|markdown-pdf|yzane|0.1.7|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.2.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. change Theme to "Light(Visual Studio)" or other "Light" theme.
2. save file as "markdown" like foo.md
2. change input mode to "Hiragana"
3. enter characters.

Then, I cannot see characters entering in the IME.
When I enter characters in "Untitled Document", I can see characters. 
And, when I use dark theme , I can see characters.
I prefer to use light theme, so I confused.

Is there any idea?
